text: Chrysothamnus depressus called Long-flowered rabbitbrush, is a North American species of flowering plants in the aster tribe within the sunflower family. It is native to the southwestern United States, the States of California, Arizona, New Mexico, Nevada, Utah, and Colorado.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map It grows in dry canyons, rocky crevices and similar habitats in the Mohave Desert, the Colorado Plateau, etc.Flora of North America, Long-flowered rabbitbrush. Chrysothamnus depressus Nuttall, Proc. Acad. Nat. Sci. Philadelphia. 4: 19. 1848. It produces large, dense arrays of small yellow flower heads, each with disc florets but no ray florets. ==References== Category:Astereae Category:Flora of the Southwestern United States Category:Flora of the California desert regions Category:Flora of Colorado Category:Flora of New Mexico Category:Flora of the Colorado Plateau and Canyonlands region Category:Natural history of the Mojave Desert Category:Plants described in 1848 Category:Taxa named by Thomas Nuttall
